intro: Claoxylon kotoense, commonly known as the Kotoense wood vine, is a climbing plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
